page.title: 02MONT ORGUEIL CASTLE (1)
page.content:
On a soggy Wednesday 26th June 1985 2nd year set one (Humanities) of Grainville School braved the elements and set off to Mont Orgueil Castle (Mount Pride), or Gorey Castle as it is often called. We arrived, after fifteen minutes of travelling, at the early 13th century castle. It is built on a natural mound and overlooks{Gorey {harbour}to the west and{St.Catherine's {Bay}to the north, with sea stretching out to the south and east to the coast of France.
The castle was originally built for defence against the French, but as one of the wax-works scenes depicts it was later replaced by{Elizabeth Castle, } because with the invention of cannon it could easily be captured if the enemy managed to reach the hill overlooking the castle to the west.
